page.title: 08Grantham:Harrowby Hall
page.content: To the east of Grantham the fields go steeply uphill via Hall's Hill or Beacon Hill to Harrowby Hall.The open space at the top of Hall's Hill is locally known as the Hills and Hollows, so called after stone had been extracted for roads earlier this century.It is now a popular area for walking and also for scrambling on low powered motor bikes.Harrowby Hall is a 17th or 18th century farm house which is now a private dwelling house. The local people claim that the Hall is haunted. There is a winding footpath leading up to the Hall and one ghost is reported to climb the path whilst another appears at the windows.There is also a story that a ghost of a women can be seen at night coming out of the well
